comments.text:
Filed by: philringnalda [at] gmail.com

https://treeherder.mozilla.org/logviewer.html#?job_id=102934468&repo=mozilla-inbound

https://queue.taskcluster.net/v1/task/BS_jByKmScWJc10PGBBJNw/runs/0/artifacts/public/logs/live_backing.log
comments.author: intermittent-bug-filer@mozilla.bugs

comments.text:
20 failures in 167 pushes (0.12 failures/push) were associated with this bug yesterday.   

Repository breakdown:
* mozilla-inbound: 9
* autoland: 7
* mozilla-central: 2
* graphics: 2

Platform breakdown:
* linux64: 17
* linux32: 3

For more details, see:
https://brasstacks.mozilla.com/orangefactor/?display=Bug&bugid=1368603&startday=2017-05-30&endday=2017-05-30&tree=all
comments.author: orangefactor@bots.tld

comments.text: Retriggers on inbound are pointing at bug 1368286 as the culprit. This is also looking frequent enough that it probably warrants more attention than P3 would suggest it'll get.
comments.author: ryanvm@gmail.com

comments.text: thanks for narrowing this down :ryanvm
comments.author: jmaher@mozilla.com

comments.text: I'll take a look at the log and see if I can figure out whether the changes in bug 1368286 tickled a pre-existing race condition, or if it's an actual regression from bug 1368286.
comments.author: bugmail@mozilla.staktrace.com

comments.text: There are other regressions being reported from bug 1368286. It sounds like there's a bug in that code.
comments.author: bugmail@mozilla.staktrace.com

comments.text: I also see in the logs bug 1300275 showing up (gfx/layers/apz/test/mochitest/test_interrupted_reflow.html | Test timed out.)
comments.author: jmaher@mozilla.com

comments.text: This (and bug 1300275) went away with the backout of bug 1368286. If it comes back with the updated version of that patch I'll investigate. Clearing ni for now.
comments.author: bugmail@mozilla.staktrace.com

comments.text: I verified by testing on the try server that my upcoming patch for bug 1368286 doesn't bring this intermittent back.
comments.author: ehsan@mozilla.com

comments.text:
77 failures in 820 pushes (0.094 failures/push) were associated with this bug in the last 7 days. 

This is the #13 most frequent failure this week. 

** This failure happened more than 75 times this week! Resolving this bug is a very high priority. **

** Try to resolve this bug as soon as possible. If unresolved for 1 week, the affected test(s) may be disabled. **

comments.text: This failure seems to happen because the helper_bug1346632.html is supposed to trigger a scroll (by simulating a user mouse-drag of the scrollbar) but for some reason the scroll doesn't happen. According to the screenshots the scrollbar is still at the top of the track indicating the attempt to scroll the bar failed.
